parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
Of Latin origin but uncertain significance; Titus, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To send together with. From sun and apostello; to despatch in company with.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Of Latin origin but uncertain significance; Titus, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To take advantage of, overreach, defraud. From pleonektes; to be covetous, i.e. to over-reach.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
If not, unless, whether at all. From me and the neuter of tis; whether at all.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Neuter 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A track, footstep. From ikneomai; a track.
